unnormalised: **Question:** What are some yoga practices you swear by for overall well-being?
normalised: Okay, so as a perpetually stressed-out software engineer working late in Bangalore, let me tell you, yoga is a lifesaver. I'm no Doctor Oz, but I've seen real improvements.

unnormalised: Okay, so as a perpetually stressed-out software engineer working late in Bangalore, let me tell you, yoga is a lifesaver. I'm no Dr. Oz, but I've seen real improvements.
normalised: First, Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations). Seriously, ten rounds in the morning gets your blood pumping and sets the mood for the day. It’s like a mini workout, plus a spiritual boost.

unnormalised: First, **Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations)**. Seriously, 10 rounds in the morning gets your blood pumping and sets the mood for the day. It’s like a mini workout, plus a spiritual boost.
normalised: Then there's Pranayama. I specifically do Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) and Kapalabhati (skull shining breath) for about fifteen minutes each. Helps clear my head after those endless Zoom calls. You can easily find tutorials online by Patanjali Yogpeeth experts.

unnormalised: Then there's **Pranayama**. I specifically do Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) and Kapalabhati (skull shining breath) for about 15 minutes each. Helps clear my head after those endless Zoom calls. You can easily find tutorials online by Patanjali Yogpeeth experts.
normalised: For physical postures (Asanas), I lean on Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) for stretching and Adho Mukka Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog) because it just feels good! I try to hold each for at least thirty seconds.

unnormalised: For physical postures (Asanas), I lean on **Trikonasana (Triangle Pose)** for stretching and **Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog)** because it just feels good! I try to hold each for at least 30 seconds.
normalised: Beyond that, even just five minutes of Yoga Nidra (yogic sleep) before bed makes a huge difference in my sleep quality. I downloaded a guided meditation from a teacher near Rishikesh.

unnormalised: Beyond that, even just 5 minutes of **Yoga Nidra (yogic sleep)** before bed makes a huge difference in my sleep quality. I downloaded a guided meditation from a teacher near Rishikesh.
normalised: Investing in a decent yoga mat (I have a six millimeter one that's about seventy two by twenty four inches) and dedicating a one hundred square feet space in my apartment was crucial. Also, find a good teacher - even online - who understands your body and needs. I started with classes at a local studio, but now I mostly practice at home. The initial rupees five thousand I spent on a few introductory classes was well worth it!

normalised: Remember to listen to your body and don't push yourself too hard. Yoga isn't a competition, it's about finding balance and peace. Shanti, Shanti, Shanti.
